marketNews.title: Oil Prices Jump After Biden Mentions Israel May Attack Iran
marketNews.content: Oil prices on the futures market surged +5.03% to $77.62 per barrel on Thursday night (3 Oct) after U.S. President Joe Biden said the United States and Israel were discussing the possibility of attacking Iranian oil facilities. The rally continued on Friday (4 Oct), with Brent futures up +1.12% to $78.5 per barrel. The BBC reported that Biden made the comment as he left the White House and that his remarks did not clearly convey the U.S. government’s stance. Biden had previously said he would not support an Israeli strike on Iran’s nuclear facilities. The statement came a day after an anonymous Israeli official told Axios that Israel would launch a retaliatory strike, likely targeting Iranian oil production facilities and other strategic sites. Earlier, Iran launched its largest attack on Israel on Tuesday (1 Oct) in retaliation for Israel’s strike on Hezbollah in Lebanon the previous weekend. Iran, the OPEC’s third-largest producer, produced 3.7 million barrels per day in August 2024, about 4 % of global output. The short-term price outlook depends on geopolitical developments, according to SEB’s commodity analyst Bjarne Schieldrop, who said oil could spike to $200 per barrel if all Iranian oil infrastructure were destroyed. Oil-related and support-sector stocks rose on Friday (4 Oct): $MEDC +3.65%, $ENRG +6.19%, $ELSA +3.24%, $LEAD +4.0%, and $WINS +1.67%, driven by the oil price rally. The article was first released in Stockbit Commentary.

marketNews.title: India Approves $1.2 Billion Plan to Double Edible-Oil Output
marketNews.content: The Indian government on Thursday (3 Oct) approved a $1.2 billion programme to double the country’s edible-oil production within seven years, aiming to cut reliance on imports. India is the world’s largest edible-oil importer, sourcing almost two-thirds of its consumption from overseas, mainly CPO, soybean and sunflower oil from Indonesia, Malaysia, Argentina, Brazil, Russia and Ukraine.

marketNews.title: U.S. Initial Unemployment Claims Rise to 225,000
marketNews.content: Initial U.S. unemployment benefit claims rose by 6,000 to 225,000 for the week ending 28 Sep 2024, above the 220,000 consensus and the highest level in three weeks.

marketNews.title: U.S. Services PMI Climbs to 54.9 in September
marketNews.content: The U.S. Services Purchasing Managers' Index rose to 54.9 in September 2024, up from 51.5 in August and above the 51.7 forecast, marking the strongest growth since February 2023.

marketNews.title: BEI Issues New Short-Selling and Margin Rules
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) issued new rules on short-selling and margin on Thursday (3 Oct). BEI Director Jeffrey Hendrik said no member has yet applied for a short-selling licence, although 23 members have expressed interest. He expects the first licences to be granted by the end of 2024, allowing short-selling to begin in 1Q25.

marketNews.title: ADHI Wins Court Ruling Rejecting PKPU Suit
marketNews.content: Adhi Karya (ADHI) announced that the court rejected the debt-payment postponement (PKPU) request filed by PT Dutasari Citralaras and its director Machfud Suroso on Thursday (3 Oct). The earlier lawsuit, filed at the end of September 2024, sought to halt a Rp91 billion PKPU related to the Hambalang project.

marketNews.title: CBUT Plans Entry into Packaged Cooking-Oil Market
marketNews.content: Citra Borneo Utama (CBUT) CEO Ronny Hertantyo Raharjo told Investor Daily that the company is preparing to enter the packaged cooking-oil market with its own brand. The downstream product will be packaged oil (olein) sold in pillow-pack and bottle formats, initially targeting Central Kalimantan and other regional markets before a national rollout.

tickerNews.title: AUTO Announces Interim Dividend of Rp57 per Share, Yield 2.4%
tickerNews.content: Astra Otoparts (AUTO) will distribute an interim dividend for FY 2024 amounting to Rp274.7 million, or Rp57 per share. The dividend is payable on 24 Oct 2024, with the cum-dividend date on 14 Oct 2024. Based on the Friday (4 Oct) closing price of Rp2,360 per share, the implied dividend yield is 2.4%.

tickerNews.title: BRIS Director Hery Gunardi Increases Shareholding to 0.007 %
tickerNews.content: Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS) director Hery Gunardi increased his holding by 976,800 shares at an average price of Rp3,071 per share on 26 Sep 2024, valued at roughly Rp3 billion. The transaction, part of remuneration, raised his ownership from 0.005 % to 0.007 %.

tickerNews.title: TAPG to Launch Palm-Kernel Bio-Coke JV in Early 2026
tickerNews.content: Triputra Agro Persada (TAPG) corporate secretary Joni Tjeng said the joint venture between TAPG and Japan’s Aisin Takaoka Co. Ltd. will commence commercial operations in early 2026, producing bio-coke from palm-kernel shells. The bio-coke will serve as a coal-coke alternative for the steel-casting industry.

tickerNews.title: SUNI to Build Rp432 Billion Second Plant in Batam
tickerNews.content: Sunindo (SUNI) CEO Freddy Soejandy said the company will build a second plant worth Rp432 billion in Batam, targeted for completion in 1Q25 or 2Q25. The new plant follows full utilisation of the existing facility; capacity details were not disclosed. SUNI, which makes oil-country tubular goods (OCTG) for the oil-and-gas sector, also plans to expand into geothermal, a project still in market-development stage.

tickerNews.title: MSTI Launches 16 Million-Share Employee Stock Option Programme
tickerNews.content: Mastersystem Infotama issued a Management Employee Stock Option Programme (MESOP) Phase I covering roughly 16 million shares at an exercise price of Rp1,482 per share, exercisable until 8 Nov 2026.

tickerNews.title: PMMP Shares Sold for Rp7.7 Billion, Stake Falls to 37.2 %
tickerNews.content: Panca Mitra Multiperdana (PMMP) sold 48.2 million shares at an average price of Rp159 per share between 26 Sep and 3 Oct 2024, raising total proceeds to Rp7.7 billion. The sale reduced the shareholder’s stake from 39.1 % to 37.2 %.

tickerNews.title: AMAN Shareholder Purchases 13.2 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Makmur Berkah Amanda (AMAN) controlling shareholder and President Director Johan Tedja Surya bought approximately 13.2 million shares at an average price of Rp114 per share on 2 Oct 2024, for a total of about Rp1.5 billion. His ownership rose from 2.91 % to 3.25 %.

tickerNews.title: MEDC Gains 3.65% on Higher Oil Prices
tickerNews.content: MEDC shares rose 3.65% on Friday (4 Oct) as higher oil prices lifted the sector.

tickerNews.title: ENRG Up 6.19% on Oil-Price Rally
tickerNews.content: ENRG shares climbed 6.19% on Friday (4 Oct) amid the oil-price rally.

tickerNews.title: ELSA Up 3.24% on Oil-Price Gains
tickerNews.content: ELSA shares increased 3.24% on Friday (4 Oct) as oil-price gains supported the sector.

tickerNews.title: LEAD Gains 4.0% on Oil-Price Increase
tickerNews.content: LEAD shares rose 4.0% on Friday (4 Oct) following the oil-price increase.

tickerNews.title: WINS Gains 1.67% on Oil-Price Rally
tickerNews.content: WINS shares advanced 1.67% on Friday (4 Oct) as the oil-price rally continued.

tickerNews.title: Prabowo-Gibran Team May Revise 2025 Oil-Price Assumption in State Budget
tickerNews.content: A senior official of Prabowo-Gibran’s National Youth Voter Campaign said the administration may adjust the 2025 state budget’s oil-price assumption, moving the Indonesian Crude Price assumption to US$82 per barrel to reflect market realities and keep fiscal calculations for energy subsidies realistic.
